contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses|Canton (disambiguation)}} {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} A '''canton''' is a type of [[administrative division]] of a country. <!-- The word is derived from the Latin ''[[canto]]'' "section of a country." --> In general, cantons are relatively small in terms of area and population when compared to other administrative divisions such as [[county|counties]], [[Department (administrative division)|department]]s or [[province]]s. Internationally the best-known cantons, and the most politically important, are those of [[Switzerland]]. As the constituents of the Swiss Confederation, theoretically (and historically) the Swiss cantons are sovereign states. The term is derived from the [[French language|French]] word ''[[:fr:canton|canton]]'' meaning ''corner'' or ''district'' (from which "[[Cantonment]]" is also derived).<ref>[[Oxford English Dictionary]] cantonment and canton, v.</ref> == Cantons in specific countries == Cantons exist (or existed) in the following countries: *[[Cantons of Belgium]] *[[Cantons of Bolivia]] *[[Cantons of the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina|Cantons of Bosnia and Herzegovina]]: a subdivision of the [[Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina]] *Canada: [[Canadian French]] equivalent for the English word "[[township (Canada)|township]]", since the translation ''municipalité'' is already used for a different level of government (see [[township]]). **[[List of township and united township municipalities in Quebec|Cantons of Quebec]] *[[Cantons of Costa Rica]]: subdivisions below the [[provinces of Costa Rica]] *[[Cantons of Ecuador]]: subdivisions below the [[provinces of Ecuador]] *[[Cantons of El Salvador]]: divisions of a [[Municipalities of El Salvador|municipality]] outside the more urban ''caserios'', which border the town or city. ''Cantones'' can be thought as the more rural parts of a city or town, generally far from the actual urban population. *[[Cantons of France]]: a subdivision of ''''[[arrondissements of France|arrondissements]]'''' and ''[[Departments of France|départements]]'', grouping several ''''[[Communes of France|communes]]'''' *[[Cantons of Lebanon]], unofficial areas controlled by the various [[militia]]s and factions during the [[Lebanese Civil War]] and afterwards. Most areas have been returned to Lebanese government control. *[[Cantons of Luxembourg]]: a subdivision of the [[districts of Luxembourg]] *[[Cantons of Switzerland]]: each a semi-sovereign [[State (administrative division)|state]] within [[Switzerland]] *subdivisions of [[vingtaine]]s in [[Jersey]] *Juridical district in the [[Netherlands]]{{Citation needed|date=January 2011}} === Cantons in former countries === *[[Cantons of the Ottoman Empire]], also called ''[[qadaa|kaza]]'' a subdivision of a ''[[sanjak]]'' *[[Cantons of the Soviet Union]], subdivisions of several autonomous regions of the [[Soviet Union]] before 1941 *In 1873, "[[Cantonalism|Cantonalists]]" took over the city of [[Cartagena, Spain]], a haven for the Spanish Navy, and declared the city independent (see [[Cantonal Revolution]]) ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Types of administrative country subdivision}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Canton (Administrative Division)}} [[Category:Administrative divisions]] [[Category:Types of country subdivisions]] [[Category:Cantons|*]] {{Geo-term-stub}}
